newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Burgo sees upturn in H2 1997.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Burgo sees upturn in H2 1997.

text.p: Italian paper and packaging group Cartiere Burgo saw first quarter sales rising in volume terms despite a fall in turnover due to lower prices but is "moderately optimistic" for the second half of this year.
The company said in a statement that in the first three months of the year cash flow fell to 76 billion lire from 124 billion in the same 1996 period.
Sales in volume terms rose 20 percent to 460,000 tonnes but revenues slipped 3.2 percent to 657 billion lire.

"Regarding recent news of a price rise for cellulose and consequently of the price of paper, there are glimmers of moderate optimism for a recovery in the sector beginning in the second half," the statement said.
Burgo saw 1996 consolidated net profit halved to 100.5 billion lire against 203.4 billion in 1995.
At 1025 GMT, Burgo shares were up eight lire at 9,670 lire on a generally weaker Milan bourse.
